document.masterDocTitle: Review of Gonatocerus (Hymenoptera: Mymaridae) in the Neotropical region, with description of eleven new species

–72. Holotype female [USNM] (not examined). Type locality: Hathaway Creek, Barton Flats, San Bernardino Co., California, USA.

Diagnosis.
Gonatocerus ( Cosmocomoidea ) inflatiscapus
is a member of the ater subgroup of the ater species group. Body generally brown to dark brown. Female antenna ( Fig. 353 ) with scape abruptly and conspicuously wider than radicle at junction. Propodeum ( Fig. 354 ) with submedian carinae fine, straight, parallel, almost extending to dorsellum anteriorly. Forewing ( Fig. 355 ) without cubital row of setae. Distribution. NEOTROPICAL*: Colombia*, Costa Rica*, and Guatemala*. NEARCTIC: Mexico, and USA. Huber (1988) mentioned this species from Nuevo León, Mexico.
